Instruction: Cut each fig in half lengthwise.
Place the fig halves cut side up on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
In a small saucepan, combine balsamic vinegar and honey.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook until the mixture is reduced by half and slightly thickened, about 5-7 minutes.
Brush each fig half with the balsamic glaze.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the figs are softened and caramelized.
Remove from the oven and let cool slightly.
Top each fig half with a small dollop of goat cheese.
Serve warm as an elegant side dish or appetizer.
